channel.title: Majors on RIT Linux Wiki
channel.description: Recent content in Majors on RIT Linux Wiki

item.title: Computer Science Majors
item.description: gmakemake As a computer science major at RIT, you have likely taken (or will take) mechanics of programming. In that class you might have seen or used a command line tool called gmakemake to create makefiles for C programming projects. If you are looking to use this tool outside of class, you’re in luck because the source code written by Sidney Marshall (swm) has been published at http://www.cs.rit.edu/~swm/makemake/ and a github fork has cropped up as well.

item.title: Game Design Majors
item.description: There’s a lot more you can do with linux than you might imagine. Unreal Engine 4 can be used on Linux and will export Linux-native builds of your games (Unity and CryEngine can also export this way) Godot is a completely FOSS engine which is sorta the Linux gamedev engine right now. Sites like GOG and Steam support Linux very well, there’s really no reason not to Linux users are often willing to help contribute back and debug software
